meanings.definition: The process of becoming middle-class or adopting middle-class values.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, their embourgeoisements finally paid off, and they moved into a nice suburban neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The embourgeoisements of the once struggling family were evident in their newfound love for designer clothes and fancy dinners.
meanings.sent3: Their sudden embourgeoisements led to comical misunderstandings at the family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The embourgeoisements of the small town were reflected in the new upscale shops popping up on Main Street.
meanings.sent5: The embourgeoisements of the area brought a sense of refinement and sophistication to the community.

meanings.definition: The act of making something or someone middle-class in character or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The embourgeoisements of the old building transformed it into a trendy coffee shop.
meanings.sent2: Her embourgeoisements of the stray cat included a cozy bed and gourmet cat food.
meanings.sent3: The embourgeoisements of the dog resulted in him refusing to eat anything but organic treats.
meanings.sent4: The embourgeoisements of the neighborhood park turned it into a popular spot for yoga classes and art shows.
meanings.sent5: Through careful embourgeoisements, the old car was transformed into a luxurious vintage vehicle.
